meanings.definition: To force, press, or push out
meanings.sent1: The toothpaste was extruded from the tube with a gentle squeeze.
meanings.sent2: The playdough was extruded through the shape maker to create different figures.
meanings.sent3: The silly clown tried to extrude confetti from his nose, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were extruded through her artwork, each piece telling a different story.
meanings.sent5: The machine extruded a long, thin line of clay, ready to be molded into a beautiful vase.

meanings.definition: To shape or form by forcing through a die
meanings.sent1: The factory extruded plastic into various shapes for the toys.
meanings.sent2: The chef extruded the pasta dough through the machine to make spaghetti.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to extrude a rabbit from his hat but only managed a carrot.
meanings.sent4: Her words were extruded through the microphone, reaching every corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist extruded the clay into intricate patterns, creating a masterpiece.
